revised_title: Interpretation of Anisotropy in the Cosmic Background Radiation and Element Creation
tldr: This article discusses the mechanisms for producing temperature and polarization anisotropies in the cosmic microwave background radiation. It explores the relation between these anisotropies and the large-scale distribution of matter, as well as theories of galaxy formation. The authors also review possible sources of ambiguity in interpreting data and strategies for removing these ambiguities.
